procedure.title: To configure the Networking common components
procedure.para: The Networking common component configuration includes the authentication mechanism, message broker, and plug-in.

step.para: Edit the /etc/neutron/neutron.conf file and complete the following actions:
In the [DEFAULT] section, configure RabbitMQ message broker access:
step.programlisting: [DEFAULT] ... rpc_backend = rabbit rabbit_host = controller rabbit_password = RABBIT_PASS
step.para: Replace RABBIT_PASS with the password you chose for the guest account in RabbitMQ.
In the [keystone_authtoken] section, configure Identity service access:
step.programlisting: [keystone_authtoken] ... auth_uri = http://controller:5000/v2.0 identity_uri = http://controller:35357 admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = neutron admin_password = NEUTRON_PASS
step.para: Replace NEUTRON_PASS with the password you chose or the neutron user in the Identity service.

note.para: Comment out any auth_host, auth_port, and auth_protocol options because the identity_uri option replaces them.

step.para: In the [DEFAULT] section, enable the Modular Layer 2 (ML2) plug-in, router service, and overlapping IP addresses:
step.programlisting: [DEFAULT] ... core_plugin = ml2 service_plugins = router allow_overlapping_ips = True

step.para: (Optional) To assist with troubleshooting, enable verbose logging in the [DEFAULT] section:

procedure.title: To configure the Modular Layer 2 (ML2) plug-in
procedure.para: The ML2 plug-in uses the Open vSwitch (OVS) mechanism (agent) to build the virtual networking framework for instances.

step.para: Edit the /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini file and complete the following actions:
In the [ml2] section, enable the flat and generic routing encapsulation (GRE) network type drivers, GRE tenant networks, and the OVS mechanism driver:
step.programlisting: [ml2] ... type_drivers = flat,gre tenant_network_types = gre mechanism_drivers = openvswitch

step.para: In the [ml2_type_gre] section, configure the tunnel identifier (id) range:
In the [securitygroup] section, enable security groups and configure the OVS iptables firewall driver:
In the [ovs] section, configure the Open vSwitch (OVS) agent:
step.programlisting: [ovs] ... local_ip = INSTANCE_TUNNELS_INTERFACE_IP_ADDRESS tunnel_type = gre enable_tunneling = True
step.para: Replace INSTANCE_TUNNELS_INTERFACE_IP_ADDRESS with the IP address of the instance tunnels network interface on your compute node.

procedure.title: To configure Compute to use Networking
procedure.para: By default, distribution packages configure Compute to use legacy networking. You must reconfigure Compute to manage networks through Networking.

step.para: Edit the /etc/nova/nova.conf file and complete the following actions:
In the [DEFAULT] section, configure the APIs and drivers:
step.programlisting: [DEFAULT] ... network_api_class = nova.network.neutronv2.api.API security_group_api = neutron linuxnet_interface_driver = nova.network.linux_net.LinuxOVSInterfaceDriver firewall_driver = nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver

note.para: By default, Compute uses an internal firewall service. Since Networking includes a firewall service, you must disable the Compute firewall service by using the nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver firewall driver.

step.para: In the [neutron] section, configure access parameters:
step.programlisting: [neutron] ... url = http://controller:9696 auth_strategy = keystone admin_auth_url = http://controller:35357/v2.0 admin_tenant_name = service admin_username = neutron admin_password = NEUTRON_PASS
step.para: Replace NEUTRON_PASS with the password you chose for the neutron user in the Identity service.
